Job Title: Environmental Engineer

Location: Greenville, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Manufacturing, Other

Description:
Job DescriptionThe Environmental Engineer’s main role is to manage multiple projects in collaboration with Business Unit Leaders. The responsibility of this role is to take projects from the original concept and proposal phase through final implementation and closure. This position interfaces with all project aspects, including project team members, clients, other stakeholders, and vendors.We provide assessment and remediation services on a wide variety of projects for a very diverse set of clients, primarily within the Southeastern United States.Position snapshot:Fill the lead position in client, project, and resource management.Assemble the project team, assign individual responsibilities of the team members, and identify appropriate resources needed to ensure project completion.Prepare project schedules to ensure timely completion of the project.Review project deliverables and ensure adherence to data and document quality standards.Prepare proposals and project change requests (PCRs) with assistance from other team members as needed.Review and finalize proposals and PCRs prior to submittal to clients.Review, revise, and approve monthly project invoices.Take responsibility for project profitability, adherence to the project schedule, and work quality.Effectively communicate with internal and external clients.Comply with Corporate policies and procedures.Complete assigned Health and Safety training on schedule.Full-time employees: Available to work 40 hours per week, plus additional hours as needed to meet project deadlines.Other duties as assigned by the Business Unit Leader or their designee.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in chemical or environmental engineering.Professional license designation as appropriate for field is required. Candidates with a current P.E. license are preferred; candidates with an E.I.T. and ability to become a P.E. within six months of hire will also be considered.At least six (6) years of relevant experience as an environmental consultant or an environmental manager for a manufacturer is required. At least four (4) years of experience with project management is required.Ability to understand regulations, and present regulatory compliance options to clients.Proficiency in one or more of the following areas: air emissions inventories, calculations, and permit preparation; Tier II and TRI reporting; SPCCP and SWPPP preparation; environmental regulatory compliance management; wastewater treatment design; stormwater permitting and stormwater control design.Software proficiency in one or more of the following: ERP systems, CRM systems, or Microsoft Office Suite.Will be expected to routinely conduct engineering calculations to support project40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER trained preferred.Strong oral presentation and technical writing skills required.Must maintain a valid driver’s license and auto insurance.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
